reviews.review_msg: pretty funnny dude. I'll say that he tried to make physics fun
Easy Quizes, Funny class, but expect tough final
No Comments
Just another narcissist

I really like him but I'd be lying if I were to say my 3 mental breakdowns arent because of this class.
If you are a student in his class, prepare to: study independently of the classes, utilise peer education, and help each other.
An usually lecturers from 10 to 1, he sort of breaks it from 10 to 7 - 5.
Studying the quizzes is a good method too.
He spent most of the classes explaining how to derive the equation rather than explaining how it is related to the topic
he opened breakout rooms every lesson for us to discuss questions in groups, he didn't teach anything and expected us to know everything.
no comments
He cancelled a lot of classes and it was hard to follow his lectures.  His accent was also very strong,

His English is quite bad, it's kinda hard to understand what he says. But i would say he is a good prof, he is always in his office, he has lots of office hour. But overall, this course is quite hard,this is supposed to be an introductory course, but the class average is around 50%. i don't think that's reasonable though, and it's not B-sci WTH

He's a good prof but his notes are all examples, so basically you're learning from examples rather than notes, but it works out in the end as most of his class examples show up on the test...some tricky assignment questions but not to worry, marco's very approachable and he's willing to help...i didnt like physics before i took this course

I took this in spring 2024. He is nice and would hold an online session before each midterm but his teaching was not good. He also had iclickers. Honestly, like people say on here, he cares for his students but for a class that is supposed to teach grade 12 phys it was concerning. He curves everything though.

Erol seems like a nice guy, his teaching methods are confusing and not very clear. Take physics with simin it is much easier. Erol seems like he could be good at teaching an advanced physics class, but he makes the basics quite confusing.
This dude cannot teach and his exams are pretty bad but he curves crazy for the midterms and finals. He over complicates everything. Don't take physics with this prof

He's a good guy and I can tell he genuinely wants his student to succeed, but is wildly unprepared ( finds errors in his slides mid lecture, contradicts himself mid explanation, unable to help with any course material other than examples in slides). Language barrier does not help. Scales tho

Although his lectures could be boring at times, I would say that this prof is definitely passionate about what he does and goes out of his way to support students. Much of his exams were straight from in-class examples and tutorial questions. Just attend his review sessions and go over past questions and you'll do just fine.

Erol is a very fair professor and clearly wants his students to succeed. Although his lectures were quite boring, they seemed to be directly related to what was on the tests. He curved so hard so don't worry about one bad grade!
Review sessions before the midterms are very helpful and so are the open labs. He scales the class alot so dont let your current grade discourage you

Although his lectures aren't the easiest to understand, he genuinely cares for his students and tries his best to make sure you understand any questions you have outside of class. He also scales so much!!
Would take again. He marks very fair and scales SOOOOOO MUCH

Erol is not as bad as people make him to be. I would say a con is that he doesnt reply to emails. There are SOO many resources given in which you can learn the material. I think alot of people in my class just did not prioritize studying because the avg for one of our midterms was originally 40% (before scaling). Just dont be lazy and study :)

I would not recommend this professor to any student looking to take PHYS100.
Erol is extremely disorganized and difficult to understand. His explanations and work on lectures make topics unnecessarily complicated. I resorted to using YouTube videos and other online programs to teach myself the course as Erol was ineffective in his teaching style.

Get ready to teach yourself! Exams are brutal and unrelated to the concepts taught. Tutorials were pointless, didn't answer his emails and disorganized lectures. He really shouldn't be teaching. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Michael Chen's class is a mixed bag - lectures can be hard to follow, but his exams are very fair. Practice questions are key, and Unstuck ai was super helpful for test prep. Overall, not too difficult if you put in the work.

Ngl I barely listened during any lecture and just read the textbook. Midterms were super easy, questions were practically identical to past midterm questions. Hilarious, made everyone laugh a lot. He finished teaching the course like two weeks early. Chen was great
shits free if u study and dont fall behind; exams are super easy, he gives old practiced midterms/final exams online which are pretty much the exact same one youll take

Exams were very fair which I really appreciated considering his confusing lectures and slides. Be prepared to teach yourself throughout the course. Make sure to practice tutorial questions and previous exam questions as they are similar to the exam questions he gives.

Michael is the best! He's super funny and I enjoyed his lectures. Does not give much homework. Most of the questions on exams are derived from tutorials, sapling and the written assignments. He did a really good job teaching the material. I definitely recommend taking his classes!

Worst prof ever. Lectures are hard to understand and makes the concepts even harder than they are. Like the other ratings he makes students feel stupid for asking questions and laughs at us. His exams are hard and he makes physics so HARD TO UNDERSTAND. Just get ready to teach yourself.

Gives long winded explanations that make understanding super hard. At beginning of semester he seemed super nice, but got worse over time. Makes students feel stupid for asking questions and doesn't explain marks/just tells us to look at the answer key even tho that doesn't hit specific problems we may have. Doesn't listen to us and laughs at us
Best prof ever. He was so funny and he really wants all his students to do well. I really enjoyed his lectures and he's super passionate about physics!
Michael chen is the man. Great lecture notes and very fair exams. Keep up with the material weekly by doing sapling and your gucci
He mumbles so much and tries to explain things which ill give him credit for but it just doesnt get through to so many students. It's kind of a struggle to be in lecture sometimes.

Opposite of about every tag, he is quite a simple-minded boring prof and you tend to laugh at him, not with him. At times hard to understand and i found myself learning better from the power point slides. Only reason i went to class was iclickers. Overall he was not difficult, but i probably didnt study enough, self practice is recommended.
amazing prof, gave valuable and useful information for future physics courses. an awesome prof to have if you want to gain a strong physics foundation!

Makes pre-lecture quizzes, good way of encouraging you to read content before lecture, easier to understand and ask questions. Spends a long time on one subject, sometimes gets confused or goes off track. Uploads lecture note slides beforehand. Recommend having device with the slides during lecture, go ahead in notes if you already understand
Very funny

Dr. Chen is the honestly one of the nicest profs out there. Well respected, passionate, and clear and concise with explanations. He is very easy to talk to if you ever need to speak to him, and has a great sense of empathy when it comes to student deadlines and assignments. Stay on top of your work and you will do fine! Thank you Dr. Chen - w
Great prof that cares for his students. I highly recommend going to his office hours if you're ever confused because he can explain topics extremely well one on one.
Dr. Chen is the best prof I've ever had. He really wants his students to succeed and even gives hints before exams on what to study.
Clear and helpful, but gives very tough exam questions.

The worst professor ever!!!! DO NOT choose this professor!!! Have zero respect for students. The teaching is just fine, but never solve problems for students. When students facing online technique problems, always let us blame ourselves. He did not manage time for the presentation and said it was our fault that we don't have enough time.
